page.title: 02FORESTRY COMMISSION IN DEAN
page.content: { ALL THE LAND AROUND SPEECH HOUSE IS MANAGED BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION FOR THE CROWN. THEY TRY TO GROW 50% SOFT WOOD. THE TREES ARE CUT BY CHAINSAW LOADED ONTO LORRIES WITH CRANES AND TAKEN FOR MINING, PULPING AND BOARDS. A CLEAR FELLED AREA IS ENCLOSED WITH FENCES AND IS REPLANTED WITH HARDWOOD TREES IN PLASTIC TUBES (TULEY TUBES) TO ENCOURAGE GROWTH AND STOP ANIMAL DAMAGE BY GREY SQUIRRELS, KNOWN AS TREE RATS - SHEEP AND FALLOW DEER. SOFT WOOD TREES ARE PLANTED IN ROWS BY HAND WITH A TOOL. YOUNG TREES ARE THINNED. THE COMMISSION LET PEOPLE WITH A PERMIT PICK UP DEAD WOOD. THE COMMISSION PROVIDE CAR PARKS, PICNIC AND BARBEQUE SITES, AN ARBORETUM AND TRAILS WITH LEAFLETS.
